Rebekah repented in bitterness for the wrong counsel which she gave to Jacob, for it was the means of separating him from her 
                                                                           116
forever. He was compelled to flee for his life from the wrath of Esau, and his mother never saw his face again. Isaac lived many years after he gave Jacob the blessing, and was convinced, by the course of Esau and Jacob, that the blessing rightly belonged to Jacob.
